Articles.Content:
Mind mirroring this on something like Mediafire or dropbox?

Curse is a curse. Do your best not to support it.

Dropbox added.

@tecknobabble: good.

@Felbourn: could you update the initial post please (version supported + most recent version dl link) ? It's a bit confused and a single post somewhere will be sooner or later hard to find.

And fixing the "space in mod dir" issue would be great.

Thanks.

DL link added. Not sure what you mean by version... that's in the changelog. "Space" bug not fixed yet. I have sympathy now for those mod makers who have bugs where I think "why haven't they fixed this yet?"

DL link added. Not sure what you mean by version... that's in the changelog. "Space" bug not fixed yet. I have sympathy now for those mod makers who have bugs where I think "why haven't they fixed this yet?"

As you compile your plug-in with some precise KSP files (Assembly-CSharp.dll and UnityEngine.dll), if KSP version B use a different UnityEngine.dll than version A, A older than B (and further, KSP version A or plug-in version A means using the old UnityEngine.dll, version B is the one using the newest UnityEngine.dll), it may have issues if you have used version A without specifying it, and people try your plug-in with version B.

As you compile your plug-in with some precise KSP files (Assembly-CSharp.dll and UnityEngine.dll), if KSP version B use a different UnityEngine.dll than version A, A older than B (and further, KSP version A or plug-in version A means using the old UnityEngine.dll, version B is the one using the newest UnityEngine.dll), it may have issues if you have used version A without specifying it, and people try your plug-in with version B.

All that I know. Can you explain what he is asking me to DO, though?

As you compile your plug-in with some precise KSP files (Assembly-CSharp.dll and UnityEngine.dll), if KSP version B use a different UnityEngine.dll than version A, A older than B (and further, KSP version A or plug-in version A means using the old UnityEngine.dll, version B is the one using the newest UnityEngine.dll), it may have issues if you have used version A without specifying it, and people try your plug-in with version B.

Oh sorry not "he"

"you"

I thought you were not the same person who originally posted for some reason. Great, so YOU can tell me what you mean. The version it's compatible with is 0.23.5 which was already stated in the original post.
Its working for me in 0.24. I like it, necause i can sor for weight
Not working for me on 24.2, but I have a large amount of mods, sure it is incompatible with some. Will wait for an updated version. =)
I tried Part Catalog one time and immediately went back to this. Simple and sweet!
this is working but it does give alot of script not present message but it works from what i can tell even with new mods like the updated kw

Not working for me on 24.2, but I have a large amount of mods, sure it is incompatible with some. Will wait for an updated version. =)

When it fails, I need to see any relevant lines from your KSP.log file before I can fix it. Thanks.

think i got them right. even thou that comes up it still shows part.
@Felbourn: please update it, your tool is great and just needs some little fixes and the update (the issue when last selected mod is lost when coming back to VAB/SPH).
Yes, PLEASE update and keep this mod alive...

Just realized I never replied to this. That warning (not an error) is a problem with KW Rocketry and has nothing to do with SPO.

- - - Updated - - -

Yes, PLEASE update and keep this mod alive...

I use this version in 0.24.2 myself so there is no reason I know of that it needed a recompile.

I use this version in 0.24.2 myself so there is no reason I know of that it needed a recompile.

Change the thread title or people will bump this every week, "Hay guyzs this work in .24? plox thx!"

Change the thread title or people will bump this every week, "Hay guyzs this work in .24? plox thx!"

My newb-ness at these forums is about to show.

I can't find a link to "edit" where the thread title can be changed. When I edit the first post, it lets me change the body, but not the thread title. How do I do it?

My newb-ness at these forums is about to show.

I can't find a link to "edit" where the thread title can be changed. When I edit the first post, it lets me change the body, but not the thread title. How do I do it?

It's not obvious. There's a "Go Advanced" button on the edit screen that lets you change the title:)

It's not obvious. There's a "Go Advanced" button on the edit screen that lets you change the title:)

Fixed! Thanks.

Can't be interrupting things like THIS for too long, you know!?
Thanks for taking over on this great mod!

I just tried this out in 0.25 and it seems to still work fine.

Edited October 8, 2014 by Felbourn

I was thinking I might spend a few hours on this over this weekend. I have some ideas for things I want to do (like fix the "revert loses my saved settings" bug). If you have anything you really want, let me know and if it's simple enough then I may have time to add it.

I was thinking I might spend a few hours on this over this weekend. I have some ideas for things I want to do (like fix the "revert loses my saved settings" bug). If you have anything you really want, let me know and if it's simple enough then I may have time to add it.

Would an option to move the sort/filter buttons be possible?

Would an option to move the sort/filter buttons be possible?

Providing Toolbar and Stock buttons was on my list as well. I am not an artist, though. I don't have a way to actually make the buttons.

Providing Toolbar and Stock buttons was on my list as well. I am not an artist, though. I don't have a way to actually make the buttons.

Sometimes simple is the best -- I think buttons that say "SORT" or "FILTER" would be perfect.

Sometimes simple is the best -- I think buttons that say "SORT" or "FILTER" would be perfect.

Like... just use MS Paint? Because that's all I have.
